hints.content:
To find how many fewer pencils $\maroonD{\text{Suri}}$ has than $\blueE{\text{Kiran}}$, we can subtract.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/70ccd87087a7998a9a9ce219ff7aef26c786c623)

$\blueE{9} - \maroonD{1} = \goldE{\Box}$

Let's subtract to find the number of $\goldE{\text{fewer pencils}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/44aa74286f48b1003a17346a72149d58fa7a7452)

$\blueE{9} - \maroonD{1} = \goldE{8}$
Suri has $\goldE{8}$ fewer pencils than Kiran.

question.content:
Suri has $1$ pencil.

Kiran has $9$ pencils.

**How many fewer pencils does Suri have than Kiran?**

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] fewer pencils
